result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob A Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay DNA analysis surcharge. Pay all costs, fees and assessments. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
- Pay supervision fees as determined by the Wisconsin DOC's.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

- Attend the following programs and/or assessments: AODA.
- Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by Agent.
- Absolute sobriety.
- No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Possess no illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
- Undergo random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Cooperate with Cognitive Thinking/Behavioral Modification Therapy.
- No contact with drug users, dealers or places where drugs are stored, used or distributed.

Dosage Probation Approved

records.addlTxt: Dosage Probation Approved

Defendant Jacob A Brown in court with attorney Marcus J Sengstock.  Defendant Jacob A Brown in custody.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel, the defendant and the Court.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber privileges to apply for work and treatment for the 1st 4 month; and for the last 5 months, huber privileges to apply for work and treatment with release to the Day Reporting Center; credit for 4 days served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS with the following conditions:
- Attend the following programs and/or assessments:  AODA.
- Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by agent.
- Absolute sobriety.
- No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Possess no illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
- Undergo random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Cooperate with Cognitive Thinking/Behavioral Modification Therapy.
- No contact with drug users, dealers or places where drugs are stored, used or distributed.
- Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
- Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
- Pay supervision fees as determined by the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
- Pay all costs, fees and assessments, any cash bail to apply.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
- Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed; copy to defendant.
- Court approved participation in Dosage Probation Pilot Program and early termination of probation if defendant successfully completes program and all other conditions of probation.

Defendant Jacob A Brown in court with attorney Marcus J Sengstock.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Hauer).     Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Marcus J Sengstock in court, defendant Jacob A Brown not in court, in custody.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Hauer).
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Plea hearing scheduled for 06-02-2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed along with discovery.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Defendant Jacob A Brown in court with attorney Marcus James Sengstock.  Defendant Jacob A Brown in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
Defendant has retained private counsel.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
